message.body: This friends with benefits thing seems a lot easier/less complicated than the movies make it out to be.
there's definitely the potential for complication
Dan and I touched upon it briefly the other night. He was referring to his relationship with Amy as FWB. What I don't think he realized is that she didn't know that they were just FWB
People need to be on the same page.
And obviously there's room for complication, but I'm not getting the sense that there will be any in our situation.
that's pretty much what I told him
communication is key, and you have to be honest with what your intentions are
most of the time, the other person wants more, or is interested in a more traditional relationship so FWB isn't appealing to them
right
I find our general dynamic pretty interesting.
Friendship seems a lot more natural than the dating thing.
And it's interesting how we essentially don't interact at all physically outside of bed... yet there really isn't any awkwardness once we get into bed. I'd always kind of conflated the two.
Assuming that "soul mates" (i.e., the perfect person for you/person 'meant' for you) is plausible/real, I wonder if that means you'd be guaranteed to get along with them.
Could you imagine getting a timer and just not ever meeting your person? Like maybe they died at 18.
The funny thing is, I do sorta believe in fate
but not soul mates
Then you're walking around with the knowledge that there's no "one" while people all around you are meeting theirs
I mean, that happens all the time already, sort of.
Just without the _definitiveness_
I don't think that it's part of the way the universe works, I believe it's all in our heads
I don't believe in fate
I don't think people are meeting theirs. Im just not seeing it. Sure, people meet up and hook up or whatever, might date/get married
but it's not all perfect. sometimes it doesn't work out
Right, right.
But you don't think that when everyone's getting together around you
You're just like "everyone's happy and I'm alone"
I think it'd suck even more with the timer. Then you'd be like "everyone will ALWAYS be happy, and I will ALWAYS be alone."
I don't think that everyone is happy, and I don't necessarily feel that I am alone
I mean sure Ive had the thought before, but I just don't buy into it anymore. We are trained to believe that we arent 'complete' without a sig other, but I don't see it that way
Yes!
but, all that said, I do miss it to some extent
hehe, when I was at the grocery store yesterday, I saw bouquets of flowers and I was like, siiiigh
it wasn't like I wanted to buy you flowers or anything...relax
haha
No, I understand wanting to do nice things for people
I've definitely stopped myself from buying something that I knew someone would like because it'd be taken the wrong way
there is something about the romantic aspect that I enjoy, and miss sometimes
I don't really miss most of it, which surprises me
I mostly just miss the physical stuff
And having someone that I can count on to be there when I want them to be, without a lot of advanced planning
Oh man. Forgot about the movies you were sort of interested in seeing.
meh
lol
If we do that again, on a weeknight, we really need to plan for sleeping no later than 1-1:30, haha.
yeah, I thought we were doing pretty good at first
and really we weren't too far off
I'm pretty tired though
So we just need like an hour earlier.
Id rather nap, but I need to get stuff done so I can have fun this weekend
what stuff do you have to do?
mostly cleaning type stuff, a few things around the house, lawn
I managed to be pretty productive this wek
week*
at home anyway
http://www.focusfeatures.com/moonrise_kingdom
looks fantastic
interesting
Man, I just downloaded a ton of good music
It's pretty much across the board for either gender
"Don't be a lazy, selfish asshat. Support your partner and try to make their world a better place." <~ good advice for anyone
The irony is that the one chick is the mother of my friend's two kids
Didn't work, didn't clean, didn't cook
Sat home "babysitting" her kids while my friend killed himself working as many hours as he could to feed/house them
And then when he got home, he'd have to take care of food/house
Aaaand I need to calm down, haha.
Yup
It works both ways. People need to man up
The gendered nature of our language is so obnoxious sometimes, haha
